chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant DANIELLE N FORD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Due 7/15/2022.
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment & follow through with recommended treatment

Mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
Any other assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Follow all requirements of DHS in CHIPS case. 
Submit a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DANIELLE N FORD

records.addlTxt:
Court notes that Attorney Harless is attorney of record in 22CF245 and 22CF198
Attorney Rivard states Attorney Harless asked Attorney Rivard to attend in his place.
Attorney Rivard states defendant has been advised of Constitutional Rights and defendant is informed of charges and penalties. 
Attorney Riverd states defendant stipulates to sufficient factual basis.
Defendant concurs with Attorney Rivard's statements.20sc339
22CM6
Court finds recommendation is appropriate and sentences to 52 days which is time served.
All unpaid costs reduced to civil judgment.
 
22CF198
State will amend Count 1 to misdemeanor under 943.23(3m)
Defendant pleads guilty to amended Count 1

22CF245
State will amend Count 1 to misdemeanor bail jumping
Defendant pleads guilty to amended Count 1 and Count 3

Court accepts pleas as freely, voluntarily, and knowingly made and finds defendant guilty of Amended Count 1, Count 3 in 22CF245, and Amended Count 1 in 22CF198
All other counts in 22CF245, 22CF198 and 22CF300 DRI
uncharged 22CH001076 DRI

SENTENCE:
Court withholds sentence; 24 months probation
AODA and follow recommendations
Mental health assessment and follow recommendations
Follow all requirements of DHS in CHPS cases
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment. 
Costs are $443.00 (Count 1 22CF198); $443.00 (Count 1 22CF245); $453,00 (Count 3 22CF245)
